snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe pledged “to make the terrorists pay the price” after an Islamic State video showed the beheading of a second Japanese hostage.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe expresses outrage and anger in wake of Islamic State video showing beheading of journalist Kenji Goto, after another Japanese hostage, Huruma Yukawa, was killed earlier; crisis has produced watershed moment for pacifist country whose leader is now vowing retribution.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Sayama, Japan.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe pledged “to make the terrorists pay the price” after an Islamic State video showed the beheading of a second Japanese hostage.

headline.main: Departing From Japan’s Pacifism, Shinzo Abe Vows Revenge for Killings
headline.print_headline: Departing From Country’s Pacifism, Japanese Premier Vows Revenge for Killings
